articles.title: Friends and Somebody Somewhere actor Mike Hagerty dies, aged 67 - RNZ
articles.description: American character actor Mike Hagerty, best known for his roles in TV series such as Friends and Somebody Somewhere, has died.
articles.content:
American character actor Mike Hagerty, best known for his roles in TV series such as Friends and Somebody Somewhere, has died.

articles.title: New Chelsea owner Todd Boehly expected to attend first match since £4.25billion takeover - Daily Mail
articles.description: The American billionaire was in London on Friday night ahead of the completion of the sale and is expected to be in the stands when Chelsea play Wolves at Stamford Bridge.

articles.title: Quinlivan: My third pregnancy was a surprise - The Star Online
articles.description: TAIWANESE-American actress Hannah Quinlivan, who is married to King of Mandopop Jay Chou, revealed that her third pregnancy was a surprise and she had only found out about it after experiencing constipation, reported Sin Chew Daily.

articles.title: U.S. Supreme Court leak — and its 'radical' contents — are bad for democracy: law prof - CBC.ca
articles.description: Both the leak of a draft U.S. Supreme Court ruling on abortion rights, and the "radical" contents of the ruling itself, serve to "erode the rule of law" and "hurt America's constitutional democracy," says a law professor and former top court clerk.

articles.title: Canada is open to Americans who may lose access to abortions, but there's a catch - POLITICO
articles.description: While the offers from Trudeau's government and providers are sincere, the reality is that access in Canada is complicated and "wait lists are through the roof."
articles.content:
